intro: Salvia nipponica, commonly known as Japanese sage, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces violet to purple flowers in whorled clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Salvia nipponica is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
